snippet: The dazzling Fulton Center, opening Monday, is seen by some as Lower Manhattan’s answer to Grand Central Terminal.
abstract: Fulton Center, Lower Manhattan subway complex where nine subway lines converge, reopens more than a decade after being destroyed in the Sept 11, 2001, terrorist attacks; New Yorkers, accustomed to thinking of transit hubs like Penn Station and Times Square as places to suffer through, will find a kind of Crystal Palace, crowned by a dome that funnels daylight two stories below ground.
lead_paragraph: The dazzling Fulton Center, opening Monday, is seen by some as Lower Manhattan’s answer to Grand Central Terminal.

headline.seo: Fulton Center, a Subway Complex, Reopens in Lower Manhattan
headline.main: Out of Dust and Debris, a New Jewel Rises
headline.print_headline: Out of Dust and Debris, a New Jewel Rises
